translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Yasas
Nadīkassapa’s Birth Story
“The Fortunate One Padumuttara,
the world’s chief, the one with suchness,

analyzed: piṇḍa cāram carantassa  vāratas uttamam yasa
translated: while walking for alms,🔽from Vārāṇasī I gave the highest fame;
taking the best fruit,
I gave it to the Teacher.
By that deed, the Lord of the Gods,
the world’s chief, the bull of a man,
I have attained an unshakeable state,
having given up victory and defeat.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
the fruit I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the best.
My defilements are burnt up,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Nadīkassapa recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā nadīkassapo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Nadīkassapattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā nadīkassapaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽nadīkassapa therassa apadānam dutiya
translated: Nadīkassapa’s Birth Story is the second.
